results.title: Cork in Portugal
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the economic importance of cork production to Portugal and its people, and describes the role of the cork worker in a changing industry. Examines the way in which cork is harvested, processed and manufactured into a wide variety of products which are used all over the world.

results.title: Coriolanus
results.brief_description: Coriolanus is the name given to an honourable but arrogant patrician, Caius Martius, after capturing the town of Corioli where a plebeian uprising has occurred. He rises to distinction, but through his pride and insincerity does not govern well. He is sent into exile by the Senators after he criticises them harshly in the Forum. Scorned, he joins forces with the uprisers and plans to sack Rome. It is only through the intervention of his wife and his mother that he revokes this decision and enters into a peace treaty with the Senators.

results.title: Corduroy and 4 other bear stories
results.brief_description: Five children’s stories including the lovable “Corduroy” by Don Freeman, a bear with no owner; “The Bear and the fly” by Paula Winter which tells about a hilarious disaster at dinner time; “Blueberries for Sal” by Robert McCloskey has Sal and her bear ending up with the wrong mother; “Panama” tells of a bear and a tiger who search for Panama, the land of their dreams in this story by Janosch; Frank Asch’s story “Happy Birthday Moon” is a story about love and friendship.

results.title: Corduroy (K)
results.creator_credit: Evergreen/Firehouse Productions, Weston Woods Studios, Joe Mantegna and Gary Templeton
results.brief_description: The film follows the adventures of a stuffed teddy bear called Corduroy who waits to be selected from the shelves of a department store. To make sure he is not mistaken for used property, he embarks on a quest to find a button that is missing from his overalls. In the process, he discovers a new and deserving owner. Based on the the book by Don Freeman.

results.title: Cordelia
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Jean-Marc Garand and Jean Beaudin
results.brief_description: Guilty of loving life! A dramatisation of an actual court case in turn-of-the-century Quebec. A lively, outgoing woman is accused of murdering her husband in collaboration with the hired hand. The townspeople do not appreciate her robust personality and the proceedings in court degenerate to a judgement of her character. Filled with stunning visual imagery, this feature film captures the spirit of the time and place. Particularly useful for those interested in history, law or women’s studies.

results.title: Coraline
results.brief_description: Coraline lets players take on the role of the adventurous heroine Coraline and interact with the wondrous characters from the movie while navigating the scheming Other Mother’s web of deceit in a fantastical adventure through two distinct and interactive worlds.

constellations_other.name: Storytime animated
constellations_other.description: Abra Cadabra was the world's first stereoscopic 3D film, but animators and filmmakers had experimented with the technology far earlier and continue to use other older techniques like stop-motion animation.

results.description: Coraline lets players take on the role of the adventurous heroine Coraline and interact with the wondrous characters from the movie while navigating the scheming Other Mother’s web of deceit in a fantastical adventure through two distinct and interactive worlds. Players engage in unique mini-games and adventures with Coraline’s friends Wybie and Cat as they collect items that will unlock the mysteries of the Other World.
description_for_label: Coraline lets players take on the role of the adventurous heroine Coraline and interact with the wondrous characters from the movie while navigating the scheming Other Mother’s web of deceit in a fantastical adventure through two distinct and interactive worlds. results.title: Coral sea dreaming: an evolving balance
results.creator_credit: Coral Sea Imagery, Natural Symphonies, David Hannan and Ian O'Hare
results.brief_description: Coral Sea dreaming is a remarkable visual and musical odyssey into the world of coral reefs. The haunting and magical experiences of the reef realm are communicated through the camera work of David Hannan who teamed with scientist Russell Kelly and artist Cathy Bone to present their “dreaming”. The video is without words, but with a specially composed musical score by Adelaide composer Tania Rose. Scientific understanding begins in seeing. “Coral Sea dreaming” lets you see for yourself, lets you be the explorer. Accompanied by an educational and resource guide.

results.title: Coral reef
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Don Murray, John Shaw and Greg Reading
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Little world of Dietmar Fill”.
This video takes us to Herron Island, describes the wildlife and then concentrates on the smaller prcesses of reef builders. This program takes a while to get started. The coral photography is very good.

results.title: Coral kingdom
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: The fish and corals of the Great Barrier Reef. Photographed underwater, the film shows many different shell fish and corals; box fish, king schnapper, seaworm, jellyfish, anemones and other sea creatures.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Noel Monkman
